page.title: 13St. Levan Marine Rescue Team
page.content: {A Rocket Life-saving Apparatus is used to rescue people from shipwrecks close to shore. The following is an account of a RSLA practice at Gwennap Head. "Shooom! The rocket zooms through the air pulling out a thin rope from the cannister as it goes. Being small it does not go dead on target, but has to be aimed to allow for the wind. As it goes over the top of the 'ship' the rope lands across the decks, then they pull across a thicker rope, fix it firmly and tie it to a tripod on the cliff. There, two poles support the tripod. Then a breeches buoy is put on the rope. This is a sort of bag which people stick their legs through and sit in with a lifebelt around them. They bring the people in from the ship one at a time. About a dozen people are needed to pull the breeches buoy to and fro."{SEE ALSO 'NANJIZEL' ENTRY
